intro: Lepidium setosum, commonly known as the hairy cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–60 centimeters and features small white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, serrated, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lepidium setosum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
